sen.j: 日野 勝光（ひの かつみつ、永享元年（1429年） - 文明 (日本)8年6月15日 (旧暦)（1476年7月6日））は室町時代の公家。
sen.e: Katsumitsu HINO (June 16, 1429, - July 7, 1476 in the lunar calendar) was a kuge (court noble) in the Muromachi Period.
Katsumitsu HINO (June 16, 1429, - July 7, 1476 by the lunar calendar) was a kuge (court noble) in the Muromachi Period.
Katsumitsu HINO (1429 - July 15, 1476) was a kuge (court noble) in the Muromachi Period.
sen.cmt: 永享元年（1429年） - 文明 (日本)8年6月15日 (旧暦)（1476年7月6日））→(1429 - July 6, 1476)6 -> 15 (グレゴリオ暦に変換)

sen.j: 名家 (公家)の家柄、日野家の当主。
sen.e: The Hino Family was one of the important noble families, and he was the head of the family.
He was the head of the Hino Family, an important noble family.
sen.cmt: Moved "he was the head of""was"→comma"one of the important noble families"→"an important noble family"Dwleted "and", "of the family"
sen.e: He was the head of the Hino family, an important noble family.

sen.j: 日野重政の子で、母は北小路苗子。
sen.e: He was a son of Shigemasa HINO, and his mother was Mitsuko KITAKOJI.
He was a son of Shigemasa HINO, and his mother was Mitsuko KITAKOJI.
He was a son of Shigemasa HINO, and his mother was Mitsuko KITAKOJI.

sen.j: 妹の日野富子は将軍足利義政の正室。
sen.e: His younger sister Tomiko HINO was the official wife of Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
His younger sister Tomiko HINO was the official wife of Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
His younger sister Tomiko HINO was the official wife of Shogun Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 父政光が出家したため6歳で家督を相続。
sen.e: As his father Masamitsu retired into priesthood when he was six, he inherited the headship of the Hino Family.
He inherited the headship of the Hino Family as his father Masamitsu retired into priesthood when Katsumitsu was six.
He inherited the headship of the Hino family as his father Masamitsu retired into priesthood when Katsumitsu was six.

sen.j: 妹である富子を将軍義政の正室に入れ、足利義尚の将軍職就任に寄与して、さらに娘を義尚の夫人に入れる。
sen.e: He made arrangements to make his sister become the lawful wife of Shogun Yoshimasa, help Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA obtain shogunate and have his daughter marry Yoshihisa.
He made arrangements to make his sister become the lawful wife of Shogun Yoshimasa, help Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA obtain the shogunate and have his daughter marry Yoshihisa.
He made arrangements to make his sister become the lawful wife of Shogun Yoshimasa, helped Yoshihisa ASHIKAGA obtain the shogunate and had his daughter marry Yoshihisa.

sen.j: 左大臣まで昇進した。
sen.e: He was ultimately promoted to the Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
He was ultimately promoted to the Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).
He was ultimately promoted to the Sadaijin (Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 蓄財にもはげみ、その権威の大きさから「押大臣」と評される。
sen.e: He also strived to accumulate fortune and was referred to as "Oshi-no-Otodo ('the Obstrusive Minister')" for the magnitude of his authority.
He also strived to accumulate a fortune and was referred to as "Oshi-no-Otodo ('the Obstrusive Minister')" for the scope of his authority.
He also strived to accumulate a fortune and was referred to as 'Oshi-no-Otodo (the Obtrusive Minister)' for the scope of his authority.
sen.cmt: スペル' '削除原文の「」に合わせ"を'に

sen.e: He died in 1476.
He died in 1476.
He died in 1476.

sen.j: 医師竹田昭慶による毒殺説もある。
sen.e: There is a theory that he was poisened to death by doctor Shokei TAKEDA.
There is a theory that he was poisoned to death by a doctor, Shokei TAKEDA.
There is a theory that he was poisoned to death by a doctor, Shokei TAKEDA.

sen.j: 法号は唯称院。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist title is Yuisho-in.
His posthumous Buddhist title is Yuisho-in.
His posthumous Buddhist title is Yuisho-in.

tit.e: Record of Official Title and Rank
Record of Official Titles and Rank
Record of Official Titles and Rank

sen.j: 1441年(嘉吉元)11月28日、元服。
sen.e: He celebrated his coming of age on November 28, 1441.
He celebrated his coming of age on November 28, 1441.
December 25, 1441: He celebrated his coming of age.
sen.cmt: 日付を新暦に→Ｄｅｃｅｍｂｅｒ 25Ｄｅｃｅｍｂｅｒ 25, 1441:を前に出しました。

sen.j: 時に、従五位下に叙位か？
sen.e: At the same time, he may have been promoted to Jugoi-ge (Senior Fifthe Low Court Rank).
At the same time, he may have been promoted to Jugoi-ge (Senior Fifth Lower Grade Court Rank).
At the same time, he may have been promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 従五位下→Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.j: 1446年(文安3)12月7日、右少弁に任官。
sen.e: He was promoted to Usho-ben (Executive Officer of the Right) on December 7, 1446.
He was promoted to Ushoben (Executive Officer of the Right) on December 7, 1446.
January 2, 1447: He was promoted to Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right).
sen.cmt: 右少弁→Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right)日付を新暦に→January 2, 1447January 2, 1447:を前に出しました。

sen.j: 1447年(文安4)3月17日、蔵人に補任。
sen.e: On March 17, 1447, he was appointed as Kuraudo (Officer of the Imperial Court Affairs Office).
On March 17, 1447, he was appointed as Kuraudo (Officer of Imperial Court Affairs).
May 10, 1447: He was appointed as Kurodo (Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 蔵人→Kurodo (Chamberlain)日付を新暦に→May 10, 1447On May 10, 1447, he→May 10, 1447: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 右少弁如元。
sen.e: He remained as Usho-ben.
sen.cmt: 如元は「もとのごとし」で「もとのまま」という意味とのこと。つまり、右少弁のまま、ということです。http://detail.chiebukuro.yahoo.co.jp/qa/question_detail/q1011737575
sen.e: He remained as Ushoben.
He remained as Ushoben.

sen.j: 1448年(文安5)1月5日、正五位下に昇叙し、蔵人右少弁如元。
sen.e: On January 5, 1448, he was promoted to Shogoi-ge (Senior Fifth Low Court Rank), while his service of Kuraudo and Ushoben stayed.
On January 5, 1448, he was promoted to Shogoi-ge (Senior Fifth Lower Grade Court Rank), while remaining as Kuraudo and Ushoben.
February 18, 1448: He was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), while remaining as Kuraudo and Ushoben.
sen.cmt: 正五位下→Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)日付を新暦に→February 18, 1448On February 18, 1448, he→February 18, 1448: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 1450年(宝徳2)3月29日、従四位下に昇叙し、右中弁に転任し、蔵人頭も兼帯。
sen.e: On March 29, 1450, he was then promoted to Jushimi-ge (Junior Fourth Low Court Rank) and to Uchu-ben (Deputy-Major Executive Officer of the Right) and was appointed as the Chief Kuraudo.
On March 29, 1450, he was then promoted to Jushimi-ge (Junior Fourth Lower Grade Court Rank) and to Uchuben (Deputy-Major Executive Officer of the Right) and was appointed as the Chief Kuraudo.
May 19, 1450: He was then promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) and to Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) and was appointed as Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 従四位下→Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade)右中弁→Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right)蔵人頭→Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain)日付を新暦に→May 19, 1450On May 19, 1450, he→May 19, 1450: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 4月、従四位上に昇叙し、蔵人頭右中弁如元。
sen.e: In April of the same year, he was promoted to Jushimi-jou (Senior Fourth Up Court Rank), while he remained as the Chief Kuraudo and Uchu-ben.
In April of the same year, he was promoted to Jushimi-jou (Senior Fourth Upper Grade Court Rank), while he remained as the Chief Kuraudo and Uchuben.
In June of the same year, he was promoted to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), while he remained as Kuraudo no to and Uchuben.
sen.cmt: 従四位上→Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade)蔵人頭→Kurodo no to日付を新暦に→JuneJushiijo→Jushiinojoに変更しました。

sen.j: 4月26日、右大弁に転任し、蔵人頭如元。
sen.e: He was promoted to Udai-ben (Major Executive Officer of the Right), while maintining the Chief Kuraudo on April 26.
He was promoted to Udaiben (Major Executive Officer of the Right), while maintining the position of Chief Kuraudo on April 26.
He was promoted to Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right), while maintaining the position of Kurodo no to on June 15.
sen.cmt: スペル右大弁→Udaiben (Major Controller of the Right)蔵人頭→Kurodo no to日付を新暦に→June 15

sen.j: 6月29日、正四位下に昇叙し、蔵人頭右大弁如元。
sen.e: On June 29, he was promoted to Shoshimi-ge (Senior Fourth Up Court Rank), while remaininig as the Chief Kuraod and Udai-ben.
On June 29, he was promoted to Shoshimi-ge (Senior Fourth Upper Grade Court Rank), while remaininig as the Chief Kuraudo and Udaiben.
On August 15, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), while remaining as Kurodo no to and Udaiben.
sen.cmt: スペル正四位下→Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)蔵人頭→Kurodo no to日付を新暦に→August 15

sen.j: 10月7日、参議に補任し、右大弁如元。
sen.e: On October 7, he was appointed a Sangi (Councillor), while remaining as Udai-ben.
On October 7, he was appointed a Sangi (Councillor), while remaining as Udaiben.
On November 20, he was appointed a Sangi (Councillor), while remaining as Udaiben.

sen.j: 1451年(宝徳3)1月5日、従三位に昇叙し、参議右大弁如元。
sen.e: On January 5, 1451, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Court Rank), while remaining as a Councillor and Udai-ben.
On January 5, 1451, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Court Rank), while remaining as a Councillor and Udaiben.
February 15, 1451: He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), while remaining as Sangi and Udaiben.
sen.cmt: 従三位→Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)a Councillor→Sangi日付を新暦に→February 15On February 15, 1451, he→February 15, 1451: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 2月、左大弁に遷任。
sen.e: In February, he was transferred to Sadai-ben (Major Executive Officer of the Left).
In February, he was transferred to Sadaiben (Major Executive Officer of the Left).
In March, he was transferred to Sadaiben (major controller of the left).
sen.cmt: 左大弁→Sadaiben (major controller of the left)日付を新暦に→March

sen.j: 参議如元。
sen.e: He remained as a Councillor.
He remained as a Councillor.
He remained as a Councillor.

sen.j: 3月26日、権中納言に転任。
sen.e: On March 26, he was promoted to Gon-no-Chunagon (Junior Deputy-Chief of the Councillor of State).
On March 26, he was promoted to Gon-no-Chunagon (Junior Deputy-Chief of the Councillor of State).
On May 6, he was promoted to Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
sen.cmt: 権中納言→Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor)日付を新暦に→May 6

sen.j: 1452年(享徳元)8月11日、正三位に昇叙し、権中納言如元。
sen.e: On August 11, 1452, Katsumitsu was promoted to Seisanmi (Senior Third Court Rank), while remaining as Gon-no-Chunagon.
On August 11, 1452, Katsumitsu was promoted to Seisanmi (Senior Third Court Rank), while remaining as Gon-no-Chunagon.
September 3, 1452: Katsumitsu was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), while remaining as Gon Chunagon.
sen.cmt: 正三位→Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)権中納言→Gon Chunagon日付を新暦に→September 3On September 3, 1452,→September 3, 1452:に変更しました。

sen.j: 1455年(康正元)8月27日、従二位に昇叙し、権大納言に転任。
sen.e: On August 27, 1455, he was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Court Rank) and Gon-Dainagon (Junior Chief of the Councillor of State).
On August 27, 1455, he was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Court Rank) and Gon-Dainagon (Junior Chief of the Councillor of State).
October 18, 1455: He was promoted to Junii (Junior Second Rank) and Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor).
sen.cmt: 従二位→Junii (Junior Second Rank)権大納言→Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor)日付を新暦に→October 18On October 18, 1455, he→October 18, 1455: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 1459年(長禄3)12月14日、正二位に昇叙し、権大納言如元。
sen.e: On December 14, 1459, he was promoted to Seinii (Senior Second Court Rank), while remainin gas Gon-Dainagon.
On December 14, 1459, he was promoted to Seinii (Senior Second Court Rank), while remaining as Gon-Dainagon.
January 15, 1460: He was promoted to Shonii (Senior Second Rank), while remaining as Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 正二位→Shonii (Senior Second Rank)権大納言→Gon Dainagon日付を新暦に→January 15, 1460On January 15, 1460, he→January 15, 1460: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 1465年(寛正6)7月25日、従一位に昇叙し、権大納言如元。
sen.e: On July 25, 1465, he was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Court Rank), while remaining as Gon-Dainagon.
On July 25, 1465, he was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Court Rank), while remaining as Gon-Dainagon.
August 25, 1465: He was promoted to Juichii (Junior First Rank), while remaining as Gon Dainagon.
sen.cmt: 従一位→Juichii (Junior First Rank)権大納言→Gon Dainagon日付を新暦に→August 25On August 25, 1465, he→August 25, 1465: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 1466年(文正元)、院（後花園上皇）執事を兼帯。
sen.e: In 1466, Katsumitsu was appointed as the Majordomo of In (Office of the Retired Emperor) (Retired Emperor Go-Hanazono).
In 1466, Katsumitsu was appointed as the Majordomo of the In (Office of the Retired Emperor) of Retired Emperor Go-Hanazono.
1466: Katsumitsu was appointed as In no shitsushi (steward) of the Retired Emperor Gohanazono.
sen.cmt: 院執事→In no shitsushi (steward)後花園上皇→the Retired Emperor GohanazonoIn 1466,→1466:に変更しました。

sen.j: 1467年(文正2)2月6日、内大臣に転任し、院執事を辞す。
sen.e: On February 6, 1467 he was promoted to Nai-daijin (Inner Minister) and thus left the service of the Majordomo.
On February 6, 1467 he was promoted to Nai-daijin (Inner Minister) and thus left the service of the Majordomo.
March 20, 1467: He was promoted to Naidaijin (minister) and thus left the service of In no shitsushi.
sen.cmt: 内大臣→Naidaijin (minister)院執事→In no shitsushi日付を新暦に→March 20On March 20, 1467 he→March 20, 1467: Heに変更しました。

sen.j: 1468年(応仁2)12月、内大臣を辞任。
sen.e: He resigned as the Inner Minister in December 1468.
He resigned as the Inner Minister in December 1468.
December 1468: He resigned as Naidaijin.
sen.cmt: 内大臣→NaidaijnDecember 1468:を前に出しました。

sen.j: 1476年(文明 (日本)8)5月16日、左大臣に任官。
sen.e: He was appointed as Sa-daijin (Minister of the Left) on May 16, 1476.
He was appointed as Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) on May 16, 1476.
June 16, 1476: He was appointed as Sadaijin (minister of the left).
sen.cmt: 左大臣→Sadaijin (minister of the left)日付を新暦に→June 16June 16, 1476:を前に出しました。

sen.j: 6月14日、左大臣を辞任。
sen.e: He resigned as Sa-daijin on June 14.
He resigned as Sadaijin on June 14.
He resigned as Sadaijin on July 14.
He died on June 16 at the age of 48.
He died on June 16 at the age of 48.
He died on July 15 at the age of 48.
sen.cmt: OK(下の行と統合）日付を新暦に→July 15

sen.j: 法名：唯稱院殿圓長久冨大居士
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name: Yuishoinden-inchokyufu-daikoji
sen.cmt: 「唯稱院殿圓長久冨大居士」の読みが不明です。
sen.e: Posthumous Buddhist name: Yuishoinden-inchokyufu-daikoji
Posthumous Buddhist name: Yuishoinden Enchokufu Daikoji
